Trial_Design.evidence: This was a retrospective cohort study involving 4,987 cardiac surgery patients from 2002 to 2007 at a medical center in northern New England.

Participants.evidence: This was a retrospective cohort study involving 4,987 cardiac surgery patients from 2002 to 2007 at a medical center in northern New England.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the association between the duration of AKI and long-term survival.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Adjusted hazard ratios (HR) for mortality, with no AKI as the referent, were: 1–2 days (18%, HR 1.66; 95% CI 1.32–2.09), 3–6 days (11%, HR 1.94; 95% CI 1.51–2.49), and ≥7 days (9%, HR 3.40; 95% CI 2.73–4.25).
